item.description:
Kepler Operations Engineer

Help operate the brand-new Kepler Space Telescope! The Kepler Science Operations Center (SOC) is looking for an Operations Engineer to help track and process data from the spacecraft. The data processing system is used to analyze all of the science data from the Kepler space telescope. You will be responsible for operation of the SOC software and hardware, with primary responsibility for flight operations activities and updating operations procedures and other documentation. The objectives of the Kepler Mission are to detect earth-like planets in the habitable zone of other stars and explore the structure and diversity of extra solar planetary systems. For information about the Kepler Mission, go to: http://kepler.nasa.gov/

Specific Duties:

The Operations Engineer is responsible for SOC operations activities. This involves tracking data flow from the spacecraft and through the ground system, initiating and monitoring data processing, tracking and resolving anomalies, basic software maintenance, reporting on status, attending planning and status meetings, and writing and maintaining documentation. The Ops Engineer works closely with other members of the ground system, including the Science Office and software developers at Ames, the Mission Operations Center in Boulder, the Data Management Center in Baltimore, and the Deep Space Network and Navigation in Pasadena. Occasional odd hours are required.

Required Qualifications:

The successful candidate must have at least 2 years experience in operations development and implementation with a focus on spacecraft operations and data processing. Experience with the UNIX operating system is required. The successful candidate must have strong written and verbal communication and organizational skills, and a demonstrated ability to work in a team environment. A BS/BA in technical field or engineering or its equivalent is required. US Citizenship required.

Desired Qualifications:

Prior experience operating systems to support space flight projects, especially in the NASA environment, is desirable, including experience in mission planning, preflight testing, operations planning, training, and science data processing. A background in Astronomy or Astrophysics is a plus.

About Orbital:

Since our founding in 1982, Orbital Sciences Corporation has pioneered new classes of rockets, satellites and other space systems that have made us one of the world's leading developers and manufacturers of space and missile systems. Our commercial, civil government and military customers depend on our low-orbit, geostationary and planetary spacecraft to help them meet their communications, remote sensing and scientific missions. We also launch exciting new careers every day. Join us in bringing the benefits of space down to Earth!
